Definition: The dosage of the medication. The data structure is flexible and can describe a dosage prescribed, administered, or reported.

Short: The amount of medication taken per dose, as a quantity or range. Relative dose (e.g., per kg body weight or surface area) are indicated by specifying appropriate units (e.g., mg/kg or mg/m2 etc).
Definition: The amount of medication taken per dose, as a quantity or range. Relative dose (e.g., per kg body weight or surface area) are indicated by specifying appropriate units (e.g., mg/kg or mg/m2 etc).

Short: When doses of medication should be administered.
Definition: When doses of medication should be administered.

Short: Indicates the pre-condition under which the drug or intervention should be used.
Definition: Indicates the pre-condition under which the drug or intervention should be used.

Short: A set of codes drawn from different coding systems, representing the same concept.
Definition: A set of codes drawn from different coding systems, representing the same concept.

Short: The directions (signetur) on the drug prescription or dispensing record.
Definition: The directions (signetur) on the drug prescription or dispensing record.

Short: The way a substance enters an organism after contact, particularly, the route of drug administration.
Definition: The way a substance enters an organism after contact, particularly, the route of drug administration.

Short: The anatomic site at which medical intervention is applied.
Definition: The anatomic site at which medical intervention is applied.

Short: The maximum amount of a medication to be taken in a given period of time (e.g., no more than x in any 24-hour period)
Definition: The maximum amount of a medication to be taken in a given period of time (e.g., no more than x in any 24-hour period)
